text:
The ramen is awesome and the prices are great, you get a lot of food for your money. The broth and noodles are tasty  ! 

The spicy miso broth is super good and you get a lot of toppings and a hand roll for $10! 

The young lady who served us was very nice and helpful. 
Definitely coming back.

New favorite ramen place. The broth is flavorful yet not too oily. Usually after I eat ramen, I feel pretty bloated from the broth but after eating this, I felt like I had a nice filling meal. You can get combos with either 1, 2 or 3 rolls which is a nice addition. They also have stamp cards where you can earn a free meal!
Ramen was delicious! I got the spicy miso and it was amazing, also, the service was incredible! I will definitely be back!! Wish I could give it 6 stars!
The BEST vegan ramen, and even better service! 100% would recommend visiting here. Very reasonable prices as well. :)

Ordered the Umami Chicken with edame & was not disappointed! Really great as left overs too :) 
We ordered our own ramen + roll combo (tuna and tempura shrimp) 

Ramen 5/5 
Roll 3/5
Service 5/5 
Parking 5/5 ( wasn't too bad)

Came from out of town. Partied too hard the night before. It's Vegas. Needed some Ramen to help our hangover. Went to a place down the street but it was so busy, we looked on Yelp for another. GO!KU popped up. Nice clean place and attentive staff. But, maybe it's me. I get grossed out when a server brings you water and grab the top of the glass, where customers drink from. He did bring straws but my friend did drink water without the straw. I use to be a waiter many many years ago and that's one of the things they teach you not to do.  Then we had to ask to get a water refilled. It wasn't busy at all, maybe two other tables. 
So now the food. It was good. Was it the best I've had? No, but it did hit the spot when you have a hangover. I ordered the Ramen with thick noodle and my friend ordered the Ramen with thin noodle. When it came out, they looked the same. Oh well, we're hungry. My friend also ordered tempura shrimp. When he asked for tempura sauce. They said they didn't have any. Mind you he's Japanese. 
Another oh well. 
Overall decent experience. It is clean and the has a cozy feel to it. Food was good but nothing to brag about. Now I wondered how good the other place we left is. Hmmm.

We ordered original ramen & osaka ramen.

Original was good and a little bit "salty" which means "reasonable for taste"

But osaka ramen was so terrible! 
I called the owner&chef and explained so salty taste, she said " it is usual"
So I asked to her whether she tried it fir taste, but she said no. 
WTF?

She didn't agree her fault. And she just said "If you want I can change with another not salty ramen"

Her mind was " truely disappointed"

I'll be never back there again.

Don't waste your money if you wanna get healthy food.

Don't be afraid by how the place looks, I can assure you it's open! Don't be fooled by the GOKU name, GOKU is also the name of the protagonist in DBZ but the original meaning in Japanese is monkey. Although it's small and kind of hard to find, coming here was so worth it! However, be warned, this is somewhat of a self serve place. The Krazy spicy miso ramen was so spicy and tongue numbing but it still had flavor you'd enjoy from any spicy miso ramen. I believe they had put spinach in the ramen which is something I've never seen before, seeing something new addition was a nice touch. With the j-wrap, the only complaint I have is for the seaweed not being crunchy enough and by attempting to eat it, half of it had fallen out. Besides that, whatever they put on that roll was super yummy! Will definitely be ordering it again. Only giving 4 stars due to the atmosphere, they're probably in the process of designing the place to make it fit the feel of the name but other than that, great place! Also, free ice cream when you check in

We came upon this place unexpectedly. The food is delicious and authentic. The service is great and the owner comes out and greets you. I can't wait to come back and try the other items on their menu. The price is also very reasonable and they have great lunch specials.

The best Ramen I've ever had! The tonkotsu is my favorite! The broth is very flavorful, unlike some other places I've been too.They're sushi is really good too, very fresh. The menu is very easy where you can get combinations, like Ramen with a sushi roll. And the owners are so friendly, they came up to my table and asked how everything was. I'll definitely be coming back!
Goku had some great ramen! It's slow but it's a place you go to to kick it with friends and have some solid ramen. Sushi was solid. And the spicy ramen was spot on. Nice little place

We were traveling in town and decided we wanted some ramen for late night dinner and found this little gem from other yelpers. Awesome tonkatsu ramen at a very reasonable price! The service was excellent and we felt very welcome and were treated like actual customers. They place was quiet but the ?manager? came around several times during our visit to clear our dishes as we finished portions of our meal and offered to bring us more water/wasabi/ginger, honestly whatever we needed.  We ordered the tonkatsu ramen with extra sushi (3 large pieces) for $9.99. Also had a nice clean interior and parking was plentiful. Highly recommended and we will be visiting again if we're in the area.

Saw this place on Yelp and decided to check it out. Staff was super friendly and helpful; explaining absolutely everything about the menu. Prices are great, especially the combos! I had a bowl of ramen and two wraps (salmon and bay scallop). The ramen was good (large portion) but those wraps were delicious!!! I could have eaten six of those scallop rolls. There's also a Yelp check-in offer! WIll definitely be back; it's a great place for lunch especially with the wonderful prices and service!!!

Food: Ordered the Goku 5, which came to about $15. Included a few pieces of "toro", ebi,  avo,  and salmon rolls. Overall quality was decent at best,  however,  far better options around town. Each roll was sliced into 3 pieces.  Nori was soggy.  

Overall experience was a let down.  Nice presentation and decor.  Overpriced.

Crazy spicy ramen!!! Good thing the spice comes separately cuz its 10/10 spicy.

I got the big noodle spicy ramen with pork and salmon hand roll. I think its quality ramen for a fair price. The hand roll is a simple salmon, rice and seaweed.

I like the simple menu and style of Goku. Definitely worth trying.

Very tasty broth and terrific service!   Small place but able to accommodate our group of 10 in the afternoon.   Great happy hour specials: $5 cold sake and salmon poke!  The rolls were delicious:  scallop, tuna belly, eel, salmon and salmon skin and just the right amount to accompany the ramen!  Would definitely come again when in town.   Perfect place to finish off our spring break vacation!

Got the Poke Ball and it is excellent if you are a seafood lover!!! Also got the chicken broth Ramen, VERY excellent! I kept murmuring "mmm!" With every bite!!! The food is definitely delicious! My friend orders a chicken broth Ramen as well and was pleased! The total came out to $23 which I'd say is VERY reasonable for how AMAZING the food tasted!! 10/10!

Good place for grab and go. The service was great and decent food. The ramen soup needs more time to develop. Salmon poke was nothing different than the salad that comes with the combo, they only threw some raw salmon on top. This place is a little overrated.

My favorite ramen place! Ive tried the spicy & the original tonkatsu & the original is definitely my favorite. I love their broth & I love that they offer side sushi as well. Also great customer service!

You owe it to yourself to get some ramen here. There's never a wait, everything is home made, and everything is reasonably priced. The only reason this spot isn't constantly packed is because people don't know about it.

Been here a cpuple of times now and each time has been fantastic. The soups are flavorful and generous. Having sushi with ramen available is perfect because I prefer ramen and girlfriend prefers sushi. Perfect match for us. The spicy ramen is crazy spicy, so for those looking for a challenge order it.  See u there

good ramen, good sushi - 
I had the spicy miso with yellowtail and tuna sushi. 
good broth, fresh sushi  - 
good food at reasonable prices.
Will be back.

Come hungry with a need for that bulk, this place will fulfill that need.

Before continuing, leave your expectations at the door. Don't think about sushi or ramen. Coming in you're hit with a very cafeteria-esque, friendly type of feel. The woman in front was warm and friendly. She answered all of our questions and even directed us to the toppings bar.

I ordered the combination: tonkotsu ramen with butter, extra noodles, and 3 rolls. The ramen to me was very home style. Broth got progressively flavorful as you reached the bottom. The heaviness and fattiness wasn't too much of a problem because the bowl was topped with spinach. I liked it because my usual Vegas ramen spots serve ramen that fatigues my senses by the end of the bowl. I could continue eating after the ramen. The rolls were more like wraps. The fish and the rice were okay, but I liked how it used a bit of a saltier seaweed as a wrap. Everything had a good balance.

Not your super fancy date spot but it's really great for that homey, mom and pop, lunch break kind of hunger. Will eat again.
Absolutely delicious. They have a krazy spicy sauce that is crazy hot but worth the torture

The cashier was very nice & treated us well. 

I got the tonkotsu ramen with thick noodles & the teriyaki chicken j-wrap. The ramen was good, the chicken in the ramen was really good. The teriyaki chicken j-wrap was tasty too. 
My mom got the spicy miso ramen at mild heat with thick noodles, my step dad got the chicken ramen with thick noodles & extra chicken. They both really enjoyed their ramen bowls.
The bowls were a good size, not too big but not too small either. 

Would certainly try this place again sometime. :)
AMAZING. One stop place for sushi and ramen. The broth was amazing and the sushi was delicious. They also sell japanese snacks and drinks. Service was perfect. My new favorite spot !!

Found this little place on Yelp and it was quite tasty. The ramen is very good and we we also enjoyed the sushi rolls. I had the spicy ramen, which wasn't really spicy at all, but it was very flavorful. The rolls came out a bit later than the ramen (maybe 10 minutes) which I thought was strange but our server had let us know so it wasn't a surprise. The folks who run this place are actually Japanese, which is getting rarer. So tell the "Oishi!" They are so appreciative!

Good ramen at a great price! Not the best I've had, but definitely not the worst. Good noodles and broth. Wasn't a huge fan of the sushi options, but that's really a secondary anyways. 

Service was good, food came pretty quick. Seating is a bit weird, but we made do on a long high family style table.
GO!  KU provides great portion.   The soup is very delicious.   Be sure to check out their daily special.  We had shrimp tempura for $3.00.

This place is definitely a hole in the wall. The Veggie Lovers Ramen is soooooo good. With the spinach noodles omg. I like that whole combo idea they have going on. You can order a bowl of ramen & add a sushi roll. The rolls come with 3 pieces each which doesn't seem like a lot but after the whole bowl of ramen, it's definitely enough. I've never been here during busy times, but service is pretty quick. They make the ramen after you order. I know most places have the ramen already cooked. I've been to a lot of ramen places & this one is by far my favorite.
I tried to go there last night but they were closed. So for right now I'll give them a three-star average review. I ended up going somewhere nearby for dinner. I wish they were open. Maybe next time.
They have delicious and thick cuts of charashu in their ramen!! It's absolutely delicious. I wouldn't recommend the sushi roll but it's worth a try if you want something different.
Great ramen, good size portions and their daily special was to die for $3 shrimp tempura, perfectly cooked and super fast great service.

Yay for veggie ramen! Wanted ramen after a long day of running errands and having tried ramen for the first time in LA, i was under the delusional impression that everyone makes a mean veggie one! My bubble burst quickly as I pulled up to JINYA, got on the the wait list to realize the wait for one was over an hour because couples get table priority over me. I was starving so I started making calls from Yelp and was 10 deep when I got a hold of these awesome folks. 

Their veggie ramen is plentiful and definitely fills you up. I do wish they were able to add miso paste for more flavor to the veggie ramen but I was told this is only available with their broths that contain pork broth. 

Nevertheless it was good, I don't know if as good as JINYA (haven't had the one out here yet though) but certainly of caliber that I would return for. 

My hostess/waitress was very sweet and asked me not to rush when I was the past patron after close. I had a bit of a hard time finding the establishment but it's across the street from the Korean strip mall on the "darker" side of the strip. They give a punch card for return visits, be sure to get yours!

Always love to try to something new and support mom&pop places. Glad I tried this place. Surely hit the spot. We came during off hours so we were the only ones here. The lady was very attentive and since its our first time, she took the time to explain their whole menu and how it works plus their specials.

We all ordered the ramen & j-wrap combo. The J-wraps can come as a whole wrap or cut into generic sushi slices  which comes out to 3 pieces. If you prefer a more basic/blander broth, go with the Tonkatsu Broth. I like more flavor so I went with the Miso flavor. The chasu was very flavorful and yummy though. The ramen comes with spinach, 1/2 soft boiled egg, bamboo shoots, nori and a good amount of spinach which I loved! Most places would not include it and have you pay as an extra topping. So this was a plus for me. They have 3 types of noodles you can choose from: thin, thick or the spinach one but cost 50cents extra. We all got the thick noodles which were cooked el dante. Yum!

The J-wraps were not bad. I got it with the A section and got avocado which has cucumber and imitation crab meat in it too. I didn't care too much for the type of nori they wrapped in it as it did have that soggy chewy texture but doesn't bother me too much. Still good. The tuna and salmon appears decently fresh & not too fishy. 

They had the shrimp tempura appetizer special today for $3 (normally $4.99) which came with 4pc. These I would have to say were yummy! Love the batter they used which was not overly battered and perfectly crisp! It came with a sweet/sour dip or tempura sauce but I do have to say the tempura sauce was not the traditional soup like blander sauce. It was closer to saltier soy sauce dip which I didn't care too much for. Also got a green tea ice cream which came in a cone, yay. 

Service was awesome. The lady would come and clean out empty dishes as we ate and checked on us ever so often. Then again, we were the only ones here at this time. Although I won't doubt she is like this regardless. Very sweet lady. Place is clean & lots of condiments to choose from! Parking is also plenty. Will definitely come back.

Loved the ramen. Also love how the are reasonably priced. The pork bowl was also good. And the lunch special is great. You pay 8 dollars for ramen and for a few bucks more you can get a salad plus a small item. I got the pork bowl. The only real problem I had was that it was hard to find. I used google maps and it didnt tell me exactly which side of the street it was on. Then the sogn out side by the street was kind of small so i had a hard time finding it

There are always first times for everything, this was my first time at this place, the ramen is good for the price it is not the best but it is not bad at all, the sushi rolls are "meh" actually not good, just plain and tasteless but I would recommend this place for a quick ramen bowl, the place was empty but I guess is because it is a Sunday night on a forgotten strip mall, the place is clean and it is actually nice, the staff was very helpful and kind so if you want ramen you can get it here with no problem, price is very accesible.

Their logo is very ugly tho.

Best Ramen in Vegas! Always order the spicy miso ramen with crazy sauce. Sushi is on point. Tempura/rib eye are the best on the menu. Gone on 6 or 7 different occasions and always get great service and the food is always on point. You have to check this place out!

I want to eat here constantly! So far I have tried the original goku tonkatsu broth, and the Vegas style miso. Both with the thicker egg noodles. My favorite is now the Vegas style miso because it comes with deliciously seasoned ground pork as well as the pork chashu. The fried avocado and gyoza are both great sides, and if you like shrimp tempura, get their J-wrap roll, it's so good and fresh! My photos are the tonkatsu ramen, a take out version of the Vegas style in my sad tiny bowl, fried avocado, tuna and shrimp tempura rolls, another tonkatsu ramen because it's so beautiful, and the matcha parfait.

The Ramen was excellent and the staff was too!!! I was looking for something different for a quick lunch, found their reviews on Yelp, tried it!  I was not disappointed!  Best quick lunch I've had in a long time.  Try the combo spicy miso.... with shrimp tempura. There was so much food I had to get a to-go!

No, this is not a Dragon Ball Z-themed ramen shop. Unfortunately. It is, however, an option for when you want both ramen AND sushi. Why should anyone have to pick just one?!

The ramen menu is low-priced with a huge portion, and I appreciate how many toppings are included without extra fees: the half egg, the nori, spinach, bamboo, and a slice of charsui. The spicy miso ramen was spicy, but it was also gritty and the spice covered up any flavor depth that the broth might have had. I'd go with a different option next time. The thick noodles were perfectly chewy and the egg was just the right amount of doneness.
The "J-wraps" are like uncut maki rolls, handroll-sized and uncut, with different prices for different fillings. The contrast of pairing a fresh fish roll with a hot bowl of soup was surprisingly nice. They also have a couple of special rolls, pricing on par with a sushi counter. 

Service is friendly, location looks like they haven't quite finished the decor. Food leans more toward traditional flavors. I was told they are still affiliated with the same chef as under the previous business name, Misoya.

My family in town for a short vacation and wanted to eat somewhere off the craziness of the strip, SO GLAD WE DID! I've had ramen before in California, but this ramen was great! I had the tonkotsu ramen with extra spice, it definitely did not disappoint! The waitress was very helpful, she helped us make our final decisions for our ramen- oh and the j wraps were phenomenal as well! We definitely will be back!
Super friendly staff. Food was delicious - very flavorful broths and everything came out really quick ! Definitely my new ramen spot

Best Ramen Place in Vegas! The ramen noodle soup and shrimp tempura go together perfectly. This restaurant space is very welcoming and people are extremely friendly. You can tell this place is very well managed. They put great attention to give you a wonderful experience the moment you stepped into the store. You can also tell they prepared the food with a high level of detailed attention to present the food in the most savory way. It presented perfect and tasted just as great as it looked. You must try this place!

This place is da spot. It's one of the best in vegas. The ramen is top notch. Happy hour at 3pm-6 with Asahi on tap!! What more could ya want? 5 flippen stars. Gj GO!KU. :) That shoyu broth tough!! Got try this place if you are a ramen lover. Make sure to check the monthly calendar specials.

It's alright. For the price there's definitely much better ramen and/or sushi place out there in Vegas. It's a cute concept (J-wrap & ramen) but seems like the quality is not superior on either. 

The different salts on the karaage are interesting but the karaage itself just so-so. The same with the takoyaki. 

We might come back. We might not. 
Indecisive right now

????????????????????????????????????????????
I had spicy miso and it is actual spicily!! And great flavor too,
This place is one of the my list in Vegas.
The J wraps are really good! I tried the spicy ramen and it's good , next time I'll try the miso and tonkotsu broth ramen. Overall I'm very satisfied with the service and food. Will be back soon!

Wanted to try this new hot spot and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered what I thought was a different kind of soup base for ramen....chicken. It was yummy with a piece of marinated chicken on top instead of your usual chasu pork. Also ordered the karaage fried chicken and that,too, was delicious. Will Definitely return again. Customer service was great along with the reasonable prices.

I've been coming here for 2 years, and I've never been disappointed by the food, service, or atmosphere. It's a family friendly environment. It's a place anyone can enjoy and it deserves a lot more attention. The interior design of the interior is very well done and comfortable. 

The food is well made and always feels fresh. There's a large variety of foods, sushi, ramen, and their Japanese style fried chicken (one of my favorites). So there's something for everyone. The restaurant is also very accommodating for large groups of people.

I could go on forever but this place always has a special place in my heart and I come back every time I'm in Vegas.

If you're looking for a place with chill atmosphere great food at a very fair price. A large variety of foods, look no further.
This used to be Misoya Tomi and now they've re-opened with a new concept and menus. It's just a good as before and that crazy spicy sauce is the best.

First time here.... but also my last time. Spicy ramen is not very spicy, but is super super salty. Maybe they used Chinese spicy oil to create the taste, since the top of broth shows the same oily film. That will definitely add salt to the taste. The presentation is very lacking....the spinach were just thrown on top.  I ordered thick noodles which were ok and not overcooked.  Noodle came with one fatty slice of pork.  Nothing special. Porks taste wasn't good or bad.
Overall, I wanted ramen and was so unsatisfied with the taste here that I looked up another ramen restaurant in the area to eat again right away.

I loved this place!  It's just a little spot but the vegan ramen was amazing (they have one vegan option) and the cashier was wonderful! If you want the ramen spicier, just tell them the level and they'll give you an extra cup of spicy stuff to add to your noodles!  They also offer avocado rolls!  FYI, their veggie roll has mayo but you can request it without it!  It definitely hit the spot for my ramen craving!

Have been a regular since their Grand Opening in January. I must say with my best regards to this Authentic Japanese Restaurant for Ramen and Japanese Sushi Wraps that the quality of food is most adequate for even the classiest of people, but still affordable to the average Joe! Starting @ 9.99 for a combo meal it is more than enjoyable and enough to  have sated even the most ravenous appetite! My personal bowl of choice is the Krazy Spicy Miso Ramen with Thick Noodles paired with Gyoza, Fries, Fried Chicken Bites, and one Salmon J-Wrap. It is mom and pop run so that's a plus, they really care about their customers and are prompt to roll out the orders as soon as they are ready to eat! I honestly can't compare to other restaurants in both Las Vegas and the best parts of L.A. of how much of a rare find restaurants with good service, food, and such low cost pricing with ample seating this place provides. Whether you're a tourist or a local you'd be foolish to not come check this place out for yourself. If your trying to come here and people are afraid to take the risk stand firm for you will be rewarded with great food and praise from your friends and family for discovering this place for yourselves!

Oh my delicious! 1st timer because of the reviews on Yelp! I was very impressed and the food is absolutely delicious! I ordered the Umami chicken ramen lunch special which included salad and 3piece California Rolls. The entire price was under $12 and change. The environment is  very welcoming and the staff here is so friendly. We will definitely be back to see our server Jay G.
Always an Amazing experience with Goku. I asked if they could make Pork Fried rice with no egg, they were more than happy to make it. Needless to say, it was Great ;)

This is a pretty good place to go for a healthy side of ramen. LOL. Since this is my lunch, I decided to go for the combination 1! It comes with what type of ramen you like + a sushi roll. I really liked the tonkotsu ramen with all the spinach and the broth wasn't greasy at all. Prices are pretty okay too. Spent $11 for lunch, not bad, right? 

And oh yeah, you gotta order from them first before sitting down! All the things you need too are all on the side so better get your ass up before sitting down on the table. Lol. 

Thanks to the welcoming smile of the lady, I'll be back for more ramen bowls!!
Great service,  the ramen broth so tasty . So if you are looking for some real yummy Ramen this is the place to go.

First time coming here with my brother, thought it would be good as it was rated 4 stars on yelp! The concept of this place is to order first then find a seat. the portions are fairly small compared to other ramen places in the area. The ramen we order was the basic one, the soup was lacking flavor, had to add more spice to it to give it a little kick. The rice bowl was also lacking a little flavor too. Overall it wasnt too bad but if you want more flavor then you would need the condiments that are available to you.

The ramen is excellent and the plating of the sushi is just so cute. The food comes out fast and the service is good. Super cheap, excellent quality. Always come here instead of other ramen places and there's never a wait. The amount of toppings they put on their ramen is just perfect.

As we walked the block down from where the taxi dropped us the area got a little less desirable. Although the reviews were good, I was beginning to have my doubts. We turned and walked down the sidewalk toward the restaurant passing several ran down storefronts and reached our destination at last. 

When we walked in we were greeted warmly by the owner. She was so sweet and helpful, making suggestions when we asked and explained the menu. We sat down and, with a very short wait, she delivered two huge bowls of Ramen.

I got the chicken, with the larger noodles and asked for a little spice to be added in, it was perfect! The chicken was tender, the noodles were perfectly cooked as was the egg and spinach. The heat was mild but gave a nice zip. 

The husband ordered the pork Ramen with the smaller noodles and it may have been tastier than mine! The broth had a rich, deep flavor. 

Oh and the tempura shrimp appetizer is also a must try! Perfectly crispy but not overcooked.

Until now our favorite place for Ramen was in Little Toyko I. Los Angeles but I think Go!Ku has them beat!!

It's hard to find great ramen for cheap prices around Las Vegas. I'm happy I decided to go here. Broth was rich and savory. Pork was tender and sweet. Thick yellow noodles were delicious. The service was just as good as the food. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly, but not overbearing. I would definitely come here again my next Vegas trip.

Love trying new ramen shop!!! And this restaurant pop up to me when I open yelp app so I had to try it!! 
First of all... I love the name already 
Ramen was so good!! I had tonkotsu with thin noodle and my friend has Chicken ramen with thick noodle... both are amazing!!! I personally liked thick noodle more so please try that! We seriously got too excited and order so much. Had karaake, takoyaki, 2 ramen and 3 rolls of sushi.... we DID finished it all but please be careful... your eyes are bigger than your stomach for sure. They have specially salt for Karaage and I believe garlic one? Was so good with it. Must try!! Next time I will go back and try not to order this much so I can enjoy the flavor more

Today I went to Vegas with my pastor, (lol long story) and he really wanted to take me to this ramen place named Misoya, calling it the best in LV. But to his horror Misoya was gone and in it's place was Goku! To his delight however, we found out that Goku was run by the same chef(who used to serve gourmet course meals in Japan)!  We tried the spicy miso and the tonkotsu, and they were both beyond the hype! Miso had depth as well as a good kick! The tonkotsu was not overly salty and oily like all the other ramen place. Instead it had layers of flavor and almost refreshing after taste! The server was also really friendly! Will be stopping by here every time I'm in the area!
I love this place... great ramen and sushi.  Great service with good food.  Price is reasonable.  Place is clean and I can not express how good the food is, just gotta try it for yourself.

There are so many places to go for ramen, and this place intrigued me when I saw my friend's snap post. The place has spinach ramen! A few of my friends wanted to give it a shot. I ordered the Tonkatsu ramen (you can order spicy if you wish), and the others ordered deluxe, Unami chicken, shoyu. Everything was decent but the Tonkatsu was realllyyyyyyy goodddddd! Spicy or not I think the soup was really flavorful and rich. They also added spinach that made the ramen different from others. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to try the spinach ramen because it ran out :( I think I will come back again to try the ramen. If you haven't try it, you should definitely give it a shot!

This is one of the only ramen spots with chicken chashu and I am very thankful for this!! I've gone here quite a few times, enough to fill up their loyalty card which gives you $10 off after spending X amount of $. 


My regular order is the Tonkotsu broth but I replace the pork chashu with chicken chashu and add corn. It already comes with everything else I like to have in my Ramen without having to add it in for extra $. My boyfriend always orders the Miso Ramen, krazy spicy. They give you this literally krazy f***king spicy hot sauce on the side to add as much as you'd like into your broth and we also dip our chicken karaage in it. This is for real S P I C Y! we love love love it and appreciate this hot sauce so much! It is no joke.

Their gyoza is deep fried, perfectly crisp, and super yummy! The chicken karaage is good w/ their sweet & sour sauce that comes with the gyoza, I'm not too fond of their new house sauces they offer w/ the karaage. They also have a seasoning station with a large variety of different seasonings you can top your chicken or whatever you want with. We like the chili & salt one on our chicken. 

The woman that works here and is there every hour that they are open, I am almost 100% sure she is the owner is so sweet and welcoming. I hope that this location gets busier and stays open for a long time! The food is fresh and really good. The ramen broth here isn't as thick and heavy as other places and they have spinach, too! This place is unique and really cute. They sell extra snacks, sweets, drinks, and even some apparel along the side wall. Try this place out if you want to try a new ramen spot that's actually really good!!

Vegan Ramen amazing! Nice flavor, nice amount of ramen. Topping could use some boosting as there were very few toppings. Also, everything else is in pork broth and my hubby didn't like there was no beef option.

I've been here 3 or 4 times now, the food is consistently excellent. The pork chasu ramen is a generous portion, the menu has a ton of options, very friendly staff. Not fast, but that's ok with me. Well worth a try

Meal and service was great! Had the spicy miso  the flavor was perfect! Hubby had the Tonkotsu with a side of Krazy Sauce...he loved it! Thick noodles are my criteria to eat at any ramen spot! They have it and the texture & consistency is AWESOME! We'll definitely be coming back!

This is my first time here, my friend and I wanted some food and I've been wanting to check this place out. The woman at the front is very friendly and helpful. We split the combo since I wasn't too hungry 
The ramen was delicious and the sushi was simple and fresh. I had the takoyaki as well. I will definitely be coming back. Friendly service, simple, good food.

I ordered the tonkotsu ramen with thick noodles and enjoyed the meal. The noodles were okay and the toppings were nice. The broth was nice though, not to thick and good flavor. The pork wasn't cut but it was tender. Service was nice and wait time was okay. So overall a nice place!
The cashier is really nice and gave excellent customer service. Might come back here again with friends next time. Food was great and I love how down to earth it feels here :)

Saw some yelp friends were checking into here so decided to check it out. 

Lady working there was super nice! Checked on us a good amount, but didn't bug us. Even chatted up a funny conversation. 

The price is worth it. My cousin got tonkatsu combo 1 with an oshinko j wrap for 9.99 plus tax. I ended up getting spicy miso combo 2 with a kalbi j wrap and a spicy tuna wrap for around 16 cause it's extra for certain wraps but 11.99 for ramen and 2 regular wraps. 

Spicy tuna wrap was okay, wasn't really expecting too much from it. The kalbi wrap surprised me. Like another yelper said, the kalbi was cold, but it tasted pretty good. Shocked at the flavor combo of it. I need to go back to see what was in it. (Couldn't take pics, old phone camera wasn't taking clear ones)
I got the spicy miso soup crazy spicy, (like Mindy B. said) "good thing she put the crazy sauce on the side" because it had a kick and was sticky, like syrup sticky. I put a little bit in my ramen and I LOVED IT! If you are trying to kick some sinus butt, get it. I wanted to take some of the crazy spicy sauce home and put it on everything. The soup for me was something else. For the first time, I actually wanted to finish the broth. I never try to cause I'm "trying" to be somewhat healthy, but couldn't resist. 

My cousin would have gave it a 3.75 star rating if he was going to do a review, but I've decided differently.
3.75 stars for the wraps I tried, 5 for the spicy miso ramen and 5 for the service. I'll try the tonkatsu next time as well as the eel wrap and update cause, "I'll be back!" -unknown..... jk!

This place became my new go-to ramen house! It's a great pick if you're looking for a more casual restaurant that has a "quick meal and go" type of atmosphere.

Because their menu offers a pretty good selection of items, I would recommend making your meal into a combo so you can try their J-Wraps. There are also plenty of toppings you can add on to your soup, and you can choose between thin or thick egg noodles. I got the spicy miso ramen and loved it!

Go!Ku was formerly Misoya, but when they renovated the establishment about three weeks ago from today (1/14/2017), they decided to change the name. However, one of the employees told us their flavors and style of cooking haven't changed, even though their menu has been updated.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. One of the workers kept coming back to our table to make sure everything was ok. She even gave my fam updated stamp cards and told us she'll combine the old ones if we still have them! So sweet :]

If you're craving for ramen that's served quick or for on the go, this is the place to hit up!

Tried out this place for the first time and my husband and I were so impressed with how flavorful the ramen was! We tried the spicy miso and tonkotsu ramen. Both were flavorful without being too salty like other ramen places. The pork chashu was cut very thick and melts in your mouth. They also serve sushi rolls too. They offer a combo with a regular bowl of ramen with a sushi roll for $9.99! Such great prices for delicious ramen and sushi rolls. This is a very casual and trendy place where you order and pay at the counter and a self service station for water and condiments. Make sure you get your free ice cream by checking in! They have mango and green tea ice cream!

The owner/chef used to have his own ramen shop in Osaka, Japan before moving here to open a ramen place in Las Vegas, and I'm so glad he did! His wife works the front taking orders, and they are a really nice couple. You can't get anymore authentic ramen than this!

Today was my second day at Goku J-Wraps and Ramen. The first time I came here, I order the Spicy Miso Ramen (thick noodles) with the combination of one sushi roll which is 9.99. I was very pleased with the ramen and sushi, I have tried multiple shops and this one is up there with my number one favorite. Then, today I decided to order the Chicken Ramen with thick noodles. Again I wasn't disappointed with my meal. This is is definitely a quick and go restaurant, with nice and friendly staff :) the cashier is incredibly nice and is willing to answer any questions if I'm not sure about what to get. I highly recommend this for a quick ramen snack if you are craving it. The prices aren't outrageous either. All in all i give it 5 stars :)

I was visiting my brother in Vegas and we decided to go to this place since it came highly recommend from them. There was six of us and we went around 8:30 on a Friday night. We were sat promptly and brought our waters. We had time to read the menu and the waiter was super helpful in answering all of our questions since for most of us it was the first time.

I decided to get the umami Chicken ramen and my brother got some sort of ramen with pork. I wasn't sure exactly the combination of what everyone got but I tasted everything and it was all good. What I liked about my dish was the fresh noodles, the punch of the crunchy garlic and the leafy spinach. The broth was also really good. I love all of the different combinations available for ramen at this place. I'm definitely coming again next time I'm in Vegas!

In my opinion, food was ok. Nothing to spectacular. Ramen decent but not too flavorful. Price is decent. There's a combo a ramen and sushi roll for $10. You also get a free ice cone with Yelp. Don't know if I'll return since there was hardly no one for lunch. It might be the location as it's with several "message spas". To each their own.

This place just opened a couple of months ago! The combos are affordable and the owner is really nice and attentive. 

I got 4 j wraps: spicy tuna, tuna, salmon, bay scallop, and a order of Takoyaki. My boyfriend and I enjoyed the spicy tuna j wrap the most. The flavor was really good(consisted of spicy mayo). I also really enjoyed the fresh takoyaki as well! It was crispy and hot when it came out. 

I didn't get to try the ramen this time because I wasn't feeling it, so hopefully when I return to Vegas I will give it a try!

Amazing ramen. Good sushi and side dishes also. This place is not the most inviting, but they definitely make up for their lackluster decor with damn good food. You will not find a line here like Monta, which is very surprising. Highly recommend.

Definitely was surprised at how good Goku ramen was.  When you put spinach in the ramen, I'm always hesitant to trust the dish, but the broth was strong and outstanding and the noodles, both thin and thick, were some of the best in town.  The spicy sauce, for an additional $1.50, is well worth the charge if you're a fan of heat.  This ketchup-like substance is chili oil to the max and will wake you and your mouth up for sure.  The chasu and tofu knock Goku down for me.  The meat is more like a pork chop than chasu - well overcooked.  The tofu on the other hand, just tasted basic and bland.  Still, seems like a very nice place for lunch and they have sake deals virtually everyday.  Goku is a fine spot for a cup of ramen and you can't go wrong with chicken or pork broth.  Cheaper than other spots in town with the typical bowl coming in at $8ish with the usual meat, egg, bamboo shoot included.

Tried this place for lunch and the ramen was decent. Not the best I've had, but not the worst. I chose Tonkatsu style with thin noodles (they have thin, thick, and spinach noodles). The noodles were cooked nicely and the broth was not too salty. I like that they gave lots of spinach and was not stingy with the charsiu, but it's a different case with the seaweed paper. They literally gave me only half of a seaweed paper lol. The ramen was $8, so the pricing was not bad. I made it a combo by adding a salmon roll for $3 extra. I wasn't a huge fan of the roll, so don't think I'd order it again. They do have other add-ons you can choose for your combo such as gyoza, karaage chicken, and other varieties of sushi rolls. Add-ons start at $2.50.

This place is cute and quaint. Had the spicy miso ramen with their thick noodles & jwrap sushi (spicy tuna). Ramen was a good spice and they also have their "krazy spicy soup" if you're feeling for a challenge. Also had their karaage chicken which was great! They had a cute "shake shake" area to put whatever flavor salt you want on your chicken. I'll definitely will come back here! Arigato goku
I loved that I can get ramen and sushi rolls all in one place. My kids loved the tonkotsu !! So hidden from all the rest of the ramen places in China town. So worth your money!!
Good ramen, good prices and excelent service i will definitely come back

If you're looking for rich and flavorful soup/broth, this is the place. Came here for lunch, it wasn't busy at all. The staff was great. I had the spicy miso with thick ramen( you can choose your type of ramen). It was Not spicy at all, more like mild. It comes with bamboo shoots, half an egg, sliced pork, bean sprouts and spinach. Definitely give it a try, you won't regret it.
Good food and all. I got back to the office and this was fly was in the cup. Very sad about this  maybe I will return, maybe I won't.

New ramen in Chinatown ! 

Had to bookmark and check new spot right away. I starved most of the day so I can come at night and order away. Very spacious inside and parking available outside. 

I ordered the combo 1 (9.99$) and combo 2 (11.99). Both orders were tonkotsu with everything. The combos will come with J-wraps but I addeded more $ to pick the higher tier choice like eel, rib eye and the spicy tuna. Service was superb, lady helped us order super quick, considering it's my first time here. 

Our orders came out very quick, sadly they mixed the thin and thicker noodles up with our orders. And the j rolls are delivered to your table. The tonkotsu broth wasn't very impressing. It didn't have a wow affect on me. 
The jwraps are served cold but even the rib eye are served cold, pretty awkward. 

Overall i like this new ramen shop. I would come back if the portions were bigger for that price. Finished my bowl in minutes from starting. Definitely if you have read my whole review it's up to you if you want to try it. 

On the plus side if you order a lot, they give you more cafeteria trays. They're brown.

The best ramen ever! Love the menu and the place. Owners Kaori and her chef husband are super nice, knowledgeable about the food, and so accommodating. I will definitely be back again, and have made Goku my go-to ramen place in Vegas!

We knew ramen restaurants such as Sora and Monta, but wanted to try something different. We found Goku by chance. I tried spicy miso ramen and sushi combination. The spicy miso was so good. I never had so good ramen before. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends. It is much better than Monta and Sora I have been eating at. Also sushi roll was so good!! It is not like many other authentic sushi "pretend" restaurant. The price is very reasonable. The owner chef is very good as he used to worked at a very famous restaurant in Osaka. I will come back for sure!!

It was a solid place.  I think the customer service is the best part.  I really like the concept where it is just a counter service and the back of the house.  The server was really nice and she explained everything really well.  I had the tonkatsu ramen as well as two wraps.  I thought the ramen was solid the pork brothewas meaty but a little bit on the bland side.  It was still a very nice broth it just needed a little bit more of a flavor to keep everything together.  The noodles which where the thin ones that i chose were nice and chewy.  The Chashu I had was flavorful but a bit dry.  I really liked their soy sauce egg that was my favorite part.  For the wraps I got the eel and the chashu.  The chashu was dry but had good flavor and the eel roll was amazing.  It is definitely a really cool place ot check out.

Great Ramen!!! I usually don't like pork but the pork ramen is out of this world!!! Great prices too. We loved being able to get a combo of ramen with some sushi options. This is such an awesome little restaurant.
The food was outstanding, and the service top rate.  I'll go there every time I visit Vegas.

I love this place!  I've tried the regular and spinach ramen lunch specials and they're delightful!  Soup broth is very flavorful, not overly salty, and the noodle texture is always perfect.  They have a crispy chicken side dish that is very tasty, light, and crunchy.  The location is like a hole in the wall, but a great hidden gem for locals. The service is prompt and polite.

First time here and it was fantastic. Most certainly won't be our last
 The price is great and the staff is so friendly.

First time to eat in this place, it was excellent.
The combo of rammen soup and suchi was very good!!
I will be back here.
Thank you for also a very good service.

A year in the making as we tried to stop by last year as we drive through Vegas from Brian Head.  Last year the noodle machine was broken so they were closed.  

Finally!!  Well worth the wait.  Small quaint restaurant with a light atmosphere.  All they do is ramen and wraps.   Ramen was top notch.  I got the Original ramen which was yummy.  Got some delicious California rolls with it too.  

Busy place so a little patience.   Highly recommend.

An awesome ramen shop in the Chinatown district. Managed by Kaori and Ken Tanaka from Osaka, Japan. A wife and husband team that are humble and very friendly. This has been my go to place for Ramen since they opened. A good option if your craving for ramen without the wait times that are common at other places. They offer 4 styles of Ramen; Tonkatsu, Chicken, Miso and my personal favorite the Spicy Miso flavor. You have the option of thin or thick noodles and includes a descent amount of toppings with the option of adding on. 

They also offer various combo meals that include J-Wraps aka Maki Rolls wrap in Nori, that are refreshing and gives a kick to your standard ramen. Overall a cool counter-service option that is good and quick.

Ken and Kaori,
???????????????

2017 Yelp Review #11

This review is LONG overdue!! 

I absolutely adore this place! It's cozy and you're always greeted with a smile and a how are you! The owners are SO delightful. Sometimes there is a wait here because of how busy it can get but if you're willing to wait you won't be disappointed. 

There are times when you crave sushi. Not enough for AYCE but just enough that a roll or to will suffice. This place calms that craving for me. That's actually how I discovered this wonderful gem. I wanted a simple roll of sushi and I definitely found it here! 

You can order j-wraps which are sushi rolls in a combo of 3 or 5. Or choose from their already selected combos AND get ramen along with a wrap. My boyfriend and I enjoy both. I can just eat the rolls itself and give him the ramen and we both are satisfied. 

They've recently changed their menu up a bit and to be honest I'd say it was for the better. I LOVED their menu to begin with but now there's more of a selection; new rolls were added different choices of fried rice, poke or salmon bowls and this new Matcha parfait that I can't wait to try. 

Ramen:
-I've ALWAYS ordered their Spicy Miso and that has always been delicious. Just tried their Original flavor and that was great as well. The amount of toppings and the size of the pork chashu is perfect. You have a choice of thin or thick noodles. I always opt for thick :)

J-Wraps!:
-I can't tell you how many times I've came in here just for these. There's a variety of rolls you can choose from and their cut into 3 pieces. My favorite 3 are eel, shrimp tempura and spicy tuna. 

Specialty Rolls:

Crazy Spicy Salmon has to be my favorite. 99% of the time I order this with my order. It's not on the menu as it was a special on display before but this is a must try if you love spicy food. When I even think of this roll,...my mouth waters lol. Yea.. that sure is crazy huh!

Salmon skin roll, soft shell crab, all around the world roll and Dragon roll is very good as well. 

Try this place out! Maybe you'll like it just as much as I do :D
this place has became the GO!TO spot especially on rainy days! thanks to Jay with hisgreat customer service but also the few for the amazing food.

Tried their ramen. Very good, but not as filling as other ramen places in Vegas. The menu also has a lot of sushi rolls you can choose from. You can also pair your ramen soup with a roll in a reasonably priced combo. The place is small, but has a cozy feel.

I'm reviewing as a big fan of their lunch specials from 10:30 AM to 3 PM..

Go!ku Service:  We were greeted and seated immediately upon entrance.  We ordered 4 lunch specials, hot green tea and everything came out quickly.  Waters and the tea pot were kept fresh the whole time. Excellent

Go!ku Lunch Special: I went with the Spicy Red Miso (Big Noodles) added the Chasu Chicken Bowl, and it came with a salad.  The salad was fresh with lots of Spinach and the Chasu Chicken bowl was small in size but pretty big in taste.  The Spicy Red Miso pork broth was tasty and deceivingly spicy.  It was not uncomfortable to eat, but I was sweating slightly, excellent. The "Big Noodles" are made of egg and was fresh and prepped well.  I wish they were a little more generous with the pork chashu but it was flavorsome.  Overall, they Ramen bowl was put together well, filling and appetizing.

Go!ku ambiance:    On one wall, there's a handwritten calendar with their specials for the month.  On another wall, is a peg board with handwritten notes in the shape of a hand that were written by the customers. They have a small cafe vibe that almost feels like a mom and pop coffee shop with the personable decorations.  I dig it..

The Ramen bowls and lunch special offered great value for me in terms of price and the flavory food.  It's now a great lunch option and I'll probably be back to try more Ramen, sushi and other dishes.  But that's another Yelp tale, enjoy!  =)

My new favorite ramen joint!! It was my fiancé and my first time here and the girl behind the counter took the time to explain the menu and all the options we had. The service is great and the food is even better!! Definitely coming back and would recommend this to all our friends!!

Atmosphere is pretty chill. Nice chill and soothing Japanese music

We came in around 9pm and was told that they were backed up with their orders. But there were only about 8 people, so I'm not sure how that's possible. They also said that they were running out of rice, so they could only serve 4 rolls total for our 4 person group. Kind of strange for a restaurant that specializes in ramen and rolls to be backed up or run out of stuff only 1.5 hours before closing.

However, the staff were extremely nice to us. I really liked the cashier because he was apologetic and understanding of our situation. The, I think, owner was so nice. She checked up on us to make sure we were doing well and offered us extra condiments. She even brought us water even though the water was self serve.

The tonkatsu broth itself was really good. It was a good amount of saltiness and warmth (not too piping hot but warm enough to warm the soul). The pork slice was THICK, which was nice. Overall, pretty tasty. And for the price ($8-9), it was worth it.

I didn't like the beginning chaos, but the food and the staff saved this Yelp review.

Yummy ramen and rolls, the combinations are good deals. I got the tonkotsu, my gf got the veggie shoyu + "krazy spicy". Spicy lovers, check this place out! 

Vegetarian choice for ramen is limited to just the Veggie Shoyu *but* plenty of choices for rolls, like avocado, seaweed salad, and even oshinko (pickled radish). Can't wait to go back!

We met up with a friend at this ramen+sushi shop for lunch and was pleasantly surprised it was owned and operated by the previous owners of Misoya--two lovely people with a passion for good food and excellent service! After getting a quick tour of how to order, I went for the tonkotsu ramen with thick noodles and for extra kick, requested the "krazy spicy" sauce on the side while wifey had the spicy miso ramen. Our combo orders also came with salmon and spicy tuna j-wraps and altogether made for a very delicious and satisfying meal! The broths of the ramen were very flavorful and rich and further enhanced by the thick slices of tender chasu, spinach leaves and hearty ramen noodles. The j-wraps was the perfect sushi bite and we will definitely be back for more and share this awesome ramen+sushi place with all our friends!

Sooooooo yummy! Spicy miso ramen with thick egg noodle was perfectly made --deeeelicious. Got the spider roll and spicy tuna roll. Spider roll was pretty bomb!!! Washed it all down with a super cold sapporo. Can't wait to come back tomorrow!!!

Good ramen and good "j-wraps" (basically maki sushi either cut or uncut) at a fair price in a nice restaurant with good service.  I was a bit suspicious of the combination of ramen and sushi in the same place, but they do a pretty good job!  Good noodles, broth, and lots of selectable toppings.  The rolls are available in a wide selection as well.
We're from LA world of Great Ramen, and found a surprisingly great ramen here in Vegas. Very authentic Japanese ramen in a very humble eatery. Love it!

I came here because I was craving a little sushi. They had a combo for ramen and a j wrap for $9.99. I ordered the spicy miso with the salmon j wrap. I liked the lemon water they had available. I had like three cups of it. My spicy miso ramen came out first. It was good. I enjoyed the spinach and the egg in it with the bamboo in the ramen. My server was nice and they even gave me a spicy tuna j wrap on the house to try :-) yayyy. My j wrap came out and it was delicious. I dipped it with the spicy mayo sauce. They had a cute little cup to put the soy sauce for dipping the j wrap. After my meal I went over to their board where they let you write comments on a sticky note and stick it on their bulletin. I left a sticky note on it :-) This place was cute and happy inside. I enjoyed my meal here.

We found this place on yelp and wanted to try it out.  We walked in with 5 adults, 2 toddlers, and an infant.  We proceeded to sit down at two tables on the right side (from the entrance).  The place was empty.  They had a couple with a toddler sitting and eating and another couple at the register about to order.  Then a woman comes towards us and asks how many of us were there.  We responded 7 and a baby.  She then went to the couple who were ordering to ask them where they wanted to sit.  The couple said they wanted to sit at a lower seat rather than the bar top seating they had in the middle of the room.  When I heard this, I told the woman worker that we had children with us and we could not sit up that high.  She told us that the couple at the register wanted to sit here (where we were already sitting at this point) and I said "okay so what do you want us to do?"  She said "is that okay?" Well no it's not okay but what do you want us to do about it?!  I noticed there was a room available so I asked if we could sit in there then.  She went back to the kitchen to ask someone and came back and said it was an office and they couldn't seat us there.  So we started gathering up our children and was ready to leave and she asked again "is that okay?".  I responded, "no, but what can we do.  You can ask the other couple to sit there at the bar top since they are physically capable of and we could sit here, but you didn't do that." So, we walked out and left.  

At this restaurant, you order and sit down, so why did this woman employee even ask the couple at the register if it was okay for us to sit there, especially when we had already sat down.  They don't have the logic and sense, clearly and I couldn't even believe they would treat their customers in this manner.  I was so annoyed and upset with the whole situation. Their loss, not mine.
this pretty much describes the ramen from this place, also try the octopus balls very very yummy:)

Came here on a Saturday night. My friends were craving ramen and I wanted sushi so they found this place. Based on the reviews it looked pretty good. However, it was just okay.... and was pretty disappointing. 
When we got there around 7 PM and it was empty.... on a Saturday night...we were the only customers there.

My friends ordered the ramen and I ordered a spicy poke bowl substitute it was salad instead of rice. The poke bowl was $8 and came with: avocado, cucumber, tuna, salmon, crab, shrimp, omelet and sesame seed. 

My friends and I felt that our server was kinda weird....when he was coming with my poke bowl he had it holding it up to his face....
My poke bowl looked nice, kinda less... but I was hoping the taste make up for the portion. It did not. The tuna was really fishy.... My friend joked that maybe the server was sniffing my food to see if the fish was still good. Overall, I did not enjoy my poke bowl. I had better poke bowl before and I believe this is my worst one. The fish was probably not fresh? The poke bowl did not have all the ingredient that was listed on the menu. I did not get any sesame seed, omelet and cucumber. But my friends did enjoy their ramen. They said it was tad salty but it was good. 

Overall, disappointment with my poke bowl.
Highly recommended- staff is awesome and so so sweet. Food is DELICIOUS. Got the spicy miso bowl it was very yummyyyyy !!!

Definitely go for a combination if you're hungry. A bowl of ramen and one sushi roll is the perfect amount. The lady working behind the counter was extremely courteous and polite! I came in on Friday for lunch with a group of 6 and surprisingly we were the only party. The menu is just a tiny bit confusing, but she makes sure you understand it. Ask her what her favorite is!

I recommend getting thick noodle versus thin as the thick noodle has a good bite to it. All bowls come with standard toppings which are listed on the menu. The (tonkotsu) broth was nice and crisp; not as heavy as other places. I LOVE the bamboo shoots--very crunchy! The sushi is a pretty good size. Don't expect a typical sushi roll you get from AYCE. It's about 6 inches total in length and is cut in half.

I would definitely come back to try other rolls and appetizers.

My girlfriend and I are always seeking out new places to try in China town.  Let me tell you, not just for the price the ramen was top notch! We regular a few other places but will be coming back here more!  The server was so nice,  she was always there when you needed something and was just friendly and welcoming.  I ordered the Deluxe Spicy miso GOKU and it was so good! Get the thick noodles for sure.  My girlfriend got the chicken bowl and that was such a tasty meal as well,  chicken was Smokey and moist not dry at all and with the sauce on top and the ginger was mmmmm sooo good.  Give this place a go for sure!

This place is legit AF. Other than being located near a far strip off Chinatown, they possibly have the best ramen I've had. 

The service was great. You can tell they were genuine other than everyone else in Vegas. Super kind and friendly. I hope they continue to stay awesome!

I was laying in my hotel room with my best friend hungover after a night of drinking when we decided ramen would hit the spot. Naturally I turned to Yelp to guide us to our destination. This place sold us based on the great reviews and the fact we could get sushi as well. Sweet!

We took a fairly quick Lyft ride off the strip and headed to a plaza close to some of my other fave Asian restaurants in Vegas. The restaurant is small and we got there just before the lunch rush began. They had a board up with daily specials and they even have free wifi.

They have great combo deals if you are interested in something more than ramen. We ended up doing an order of gyoza, 2 ramens and 3 sushi j wraps. The fried gyoza was good- freshly fried and presented with 2 dipping sauces (a ponzu and sweet thai chili sauce, I believe). We ate those so quickly because we were so hungry that I forgot to snap a pic. My ramen was the spicy red miso ramen with added bean sprouts and fried garlic. Pretty damn tasty. My friend ordered the Vegas style miso ramen but they accidentally brought her the veggie lovers ramen. She didnt make a fuss and ate it. The sushi j wraps were good. They were larger than rolls are other sushi places so we accidentally ordered more than we could eat. 

Overall we had a great dining experience. I encourage all tourists to take an opportunity to dine off the strip at least once during their visit. They are missing out on gems like this place if they dont!

I'm from the Bay Area and have also been to Japan several times so I've tried all types of ramen, good and bad. 

Goku is a bit overhyped and overrated. I tried their Original and a Jwrap. Their broth is pretty flavorful, although nothing too special or memorable (unlike Toto Ramen in NY). Had the thick noodles and the texture was good. Their meat was what bothered me. It was a big chunk of meat, not thinly cut, and very little taste. The second time I came, there was a piece of hair in my broth...I told the waitress after having to flag her down and she showed the cook, and then she came back and asked if I wanted to keep my noodles and just change the broth or get a new bowl. I opted to get a new bowl, but that just ruined the experience. I still paid for it (they didn't offer to take it off the bill). The Jwraps are a twist from traditional sushi. A bit too much rice in those wraps for me. Overall, the service from this Chinese young lady was awful.

I'm so glad my friend recommended this place.  One of my biggest gripe with ramen restaurants is that I'm never full when I leave.  Either the portion sizes are too small or they don't give you enough meat or side items to make it a meal.  Well this place solved all my problems. 

The deluxe goku is the game changer.  Large portion size,  2 pieces of chasu pork big enough to be used in another bowl of ramen if they really wanted to, one full egg, and a generous portion of the noodle of your choice (thin,  thick,  spinach). 

The food was delicious and definitely hit the spot during a cold windy day.  They do offer combos if you want some sushi rolls or gyoza with your noodles for those with huge appetites.  One thing I would suggest is to offer a more spicy version of the ramen.  I had the spicy miso that was not spicy at all.  Not even a tinge of spice on the tongue.  I want something that would scorch my taste buds.  Just some food for thought . I'll definitely be back

$10 for a bowl of ramen and a hand roll.. I will definitely be back. I got the tonkatsu ramen and was surprised by the mountain of veggies I got. From first look, it seemed like there wasn't much in there but omg they give you large portions. And each it comes with an egg at no charge! All other ramen shops charge you for an egg. I drank all my soup too. It wasn't oily or too creamy tasting. The spinach also balanced out the flavors. The pork in the bowl was also different from other ramen shops. It wasn't sliced but a bbq flavored chunk of pork, barely any fat on it. This place was an order and pay first then they bring your food out to you just like how it's done in Japan.
This ramen is so good! Ordered chicken ramen, they gave me some spicy cup which is delicious! $25 for two meals that come with sushi rolls. Good price and good customer service.
I loved the ramen! The chicken is amaazing!! I will be back for sure. The kimchee was super and the tempura shrimp delicious but nothing beats their marinated chicken!!!

Have to say this is one of the best ramen places ive been to. Had to try it a couple time and different items to write my honest review. Such friendly staff and amazing food. The ramen, curry, chashu bowl, and everything in between is so yummy! I definitely recommend this place if youre looking for some ramen.

This may be my new favorite place for ramen!

I used to wonder about this place myself. Thought it was a bunch of mumbo-jumbo. A magical power holding together good and evil... the ramen and the rolls. Crazy thing is... it's true. The Ramen. The Chicken. All of it. It's all true.

We had came on a Saturday afternoon (1:30ish pm) and it wasn't busy whatsoever, like 2 couples dining in as well, but upon entering they have a sign-in sheet so I assume it can get pretty busy later on in the night. Right off the bat this mini restaurant was very clean and very welcoming. 
This place is pretty hidden especially since it's next to a huge karaoke bar I forgot the name of- but besides the point our server was a very nice, sweet older lady. I happened to look over at the cook and it was another older lady working hard fulfilling everyone's orders. 
We caught the lunch special and ordered spicy miso ramen, and for a few bucks extra you can get an +add on! For example: I got a chasu (pork or chicken) bowl for $4-5 dollars more if I'm not mistaken; and my lady got a 3 pc California roll for $3 dollars more. 
Let me just say that the ramen came out in a GIANT bowl! Filled with flavor and a giant piece of chasu pork. We enjoyed it so so much, and that's all I can say. I definitely recommend this place for ramen! 
Thank you Go!Ku.

The food is good (although sushi is pretty much supermarket quality).  The price is OK, but not much different than other Ramen places.  The décor is pretty meh.  Overall it's OK, but it didn't impress.  I wish them well and have no overall negative feelings, but I don't see myself going back.  MHO.

Best place for Veggie Ramen!!  I live in LA and this place is a must visit when we go to Vegas!!!  I always get the veggie ramen with veggie noodles and add on the egg (tomato) roll.  A friend of mine loves their shrimp tempura on the side with her ramen!!!

We ordered on yelp for pick up, we are the only customers there when we arrived. We ordered a tonkotsu ramen with extra chashu and a spicy miso with extra chashu, and a order of takoyaki as well. The overall customer service experience was good; however, the ramen soup was too greasy and the chashu had more fat that meat. The worst part was that there only one tiny piece of octopus in one of the  takoyaki out of the 6 pieces. The other five pieces were plain flour mix and it cost about 4.99. Not sure if I will visit this place ever again.

As soon as I walked in, I just had a good feeling about this place.  I went on Wednesday evening around 7 pm and I was the only one there. The lady behind the counter was very friendly, asked if it was my first time there (which it was) and although I pretty much knew what I wanted, she guided me through the menu and what options were available to me.  I got the ramen and 2 sushi roll combo.  The price was about $13.  My food came out within a few minutes and my tonkatsu ramen was VERY good, including the 2 rolls I ordered.  

I love that they offer a stamp card too, and you receive $10 off after 9 visits.  

I absolutely would recommend this place for really good food, and service.  :-)  I will definitely be back.

I was here when they used to be called misoya ramen. Looks like they went thru a branding change. Tried to stream line it to be less confusing but more fast food and hipster like. I will say that their brother has improved. The misoya version used to always be so grainy from the miso. Now I'm actually able to drink the broth. The decor could use a little improvement but i think they're still upgrading. I do miss some of the old menu items though.
Great spicy ramen ! Loved the shrimp tempura and avocado J wrap ! Def a must try , great customer service , they were so nice !

Came at around 9, they were running low on rice, so we couldn't order to our content. Food was excellent though. Ramen is sumptious, rolls fresh, and soup base rich. Kind of cold here, so wear an extra layer.
So delicious! And very cheap, my friend said he want to come here again! This is a very nice experience in Las Vegas! Poke bowl is so nice and takoyaki is also nice! See u tonight!

After watching the MJ Live show at the Stratosphere, we were hungry for something filling but not too heavy.  Ramen came to mind so we listened to our fellow Yelpers and came to this place.  What a great find!  We got the Goku Original Tonkotsu ramen along with a plate of Tagokayi.  The restaurant has a 2-month calendar on the wall showing daily specials. Lucky for us, the 6-piece Tagoyaki was only $3 and they were soooo good.  Our ramen was also delicious; the broth was flavorful, noodles fresh, and the lean chasu pork tender.  Service was prompt, prices were very reasonable, and they even had good music.  Goku has replaced Ramen Sora as our go-to ramen restaurant in Vegas.

First off they have daily specials and I wanted to try a poke bowl but I guess cause it was $5 bowls that day they were out pretty early. I got the spicy miso ramen with three rolls for $13.99. The prices are good and the rolls are 3 piece sushi style rolls. I got the spicy salmon, spicy tuna and the soft shell crab. Spicy tuna was good, not spicy, the spicy salmon however burned my whole tongue off. My friends and I were on the verge of tears and we like spicy! The soft shell crab was good too, they were all simple, with cucumber, rice, and then wrapped in nori. My friend's son got the tonkatsu broth and it was really tasty! I liked it better than my spicy miso. Overall the prices are great, service was good, you get lots of good food, just don't try the spicy salmon unless you're a glutton for punishment.

The food is very delicious the Lady in charge is very helpful though we had little miscommunication with the server they solve the problem highly recommend will be back next time if we comeback here thank you
Large party came in before our party of 5, they already had 2 groups seated and they seated and served efficiently and correctly!  And on Christmas Eve.  We will be back.   Great Food!!
Urban setting, lunch specials are good. Great for a quick break. They also have a Sushi burrito wrap + ramen  you can't go wrong with that combination.

Greeted upon entrance.. Easy to understand menu..a fully stocked sauce bar. Order at the counter and have a seat..they will serve you. I ordered the Konkatsu med spice with salmon skin roll. It was great all around.
Really good ramen and pretty inexpensive. Service was nice, and the food came out quickly. Sushi rolls are nothing to write home about, but the ramen was worth it.

Was just driving around to see where to eat and came across this place. First time eating here and will never regret it. Ordered a ramen chicken egg noodle soup, it was so good. Definitely coming back soon, lady that took our order was really friendly and explained the menu items to us since we weren't very familiar with the food. Recommend everyone to try this place.

100% recommended
Love the vibes in here. Ramen is super good too with a roll on top! One of my favorite Ramen shops here in Las Vegas!!!

Thoroughly enjoyed this place. Needed a break from food on The Strip and this place was a nice relief. Decently priced - paid about $30 for dinner for two with Happy Hour beers. I had the Vegas Ramen which was delicious - flavorful and not too salty. The pork in it was tender. Would definitely do it again.

Came here for some ramen for thay New Year's Hangover, they did not disappoint! The spicy miso ramen was a huge bowl and the pork piece was HUGE. Can't wait to come back and enjoy it again! Keep up the great work!
Very good noodles. The prices are reasonable and the ramen is excellent. Don't eat on the strip. Get out and see what Las Vegas has to offer.

We were hoping for something cool and fresh and interesting in a Ramen lunch restaurant in Vegas. Goku is good, not great. The food is what you would expect but the side of Sushi I ordered was sub par. With all the Ramen choices in Vegas, I'm not sure I would go back to this restaurant.

This is a cute, hole-in-the-wall restaurant that serves delicious ramen with reasonable prices! You also have an option to add a combination of sushi rolls with your ramen. I ordered a combination of tonkatsu ramen with thin noodles with shimp tempura sushi rolls.

The atmosphere is very chill and rexlaxing. It wasn't busy when I first went there and you don't have to wait in a long line to be served. The lady who served my party was very friendly and made sure we were taken care of. I'd definitely come back here again!!!

The tonkotsu and miso broth were excellent, the noodles perfect, and the char-siu was rich with umami. There's also a nice option to add some small maki rolls on the side if you're pretty hungry. I enjoyed the ambiance of the place with it's simple decor and the self-serve condiment options on the side (I'm not a fan of servers). The cashier and chef were very friendly as well. Probably some of my favorite ramen I've had in Vegas and no, they didn't? ask me to write this lol.

This unassuming  restaurant is a hidden gem .The Tonkotsu ramen was Excellent. The Pork Chasu  was amazing .You get to choose your type of noodles thin ,Thick  or spinach which is a really cool option. The staff was extremely friendly informative and attentive.
CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK .
If you like Asian food this is the place to go. Great ramen restaurant food is fresh delicious and very inexpensive. Highly recommended.

I used to frequent this place but lately they have a new waitress that does not pay attention who is slower than molasses and I'm absolutely so disappointed with the way the service has turned around..
Tonight I called to make an order they tell me 20 minutes for pickup I give him about 30 I show up my order is still not ready they asked me to sit down and gave me a cup of water 20 minutes later my order is still not ready I get up stand right in front of the counter asking why is my full taking so long they said we only have one chef same waitress that does not pay attention..
Finally she starts bagging what is supposed to be my order she's according to what I see waiting for my takoyaki somebody walks in she goes in a TEND to them then another couple walks and she goes in the tens to them but another 10 minutes walk by she comes back and I said excuse me what are we still waiting for she starts walking to the chef the sharp pointed out that he already had given her all my items I lost it I told her why don't you pay attention I'm absolutely disappointment with how things turned out I did go off on her without using any curse words or French words however you want to call them but I'm absolutely and I am really doubtful that I want to return to the restaurant based on that one waitressed other than that the food is fine it makes my expectations for the price but other than that ever since she started the service is below standard

Delicious food! The ramen doesn't just count on all the ingredients to taste good -- the broth/stock is rich. 

According to friends the thin noodles are perfect. They do not have gluten free noodles (not really a shock) BUT the ramen has sooooo much meat and veggies and other good stuff (like soft boiled egg) that ordering without noodles still left me stuffed. I had to take home a container. My kids definitely couldn't finish, but they tried. They also have vegetarian/vegan noodles.

The sushi aka "j-wraps" are yummy, and well sized. I like the special where you get ramen and sushi together to save cash.

Service was good, pretty quick and genuinely friendly.

Will be back often.

Nice waiter and manager. I had the bay scallop and Goku rolls. Pretty tasty. It's eating half normal rolls so it allows you to order more variety without paying more. Quality was good, too. I was a little hesitant because no one else was eating there but many just ordered for pick up.

This place used to be nice & cosy with good customer service. Unfortunately, it is no longer the case. I used to come here for lunch & dinner often until I came here for the last time 2 months ago. 

They didn't even bother to order the reward card anymore. For a longest time they had to stamp on my receipts. Then they stopped automatically giving me stamps without me asking for them. One day we were short on time. I walked in & ordered ramen w/ the waitress, I then asked her to take order from my bf while I was using the restroom to save it. When I got back from the table, she hadn't yet taken the order from him. 
Then my ramen came w/ no seaweed. I told the waitress, she acted like I lied to her & brought me a tiny piece of seaweed.
Anyhow, I found a better ramen place with good food, great customer service for a better price. So, I have stopped coming here & I don't plan to return.

I ordered the tonkotsu ramen with thick noodle. Was it the best ramen I have ever had? No it unfortunately was not. However, it did hit the spot especially because the store was really cold. 

Their service was good though. The Japanese lady was very attentive!

I wanted something great without the hassle of the Strip and at a great price. This cute little place did not disappoint. I picked up the Chicken Ramen. The ingredients are fresh and the broth has a nice and rich taste. This ramen is great on these Winter nights.
We ran across this place after a YELP search. It was totally what we were expecting. It had great service and food. The prices were good as well. We will be back for sure.

This review is based on my second visit, the first time I ordered carry out J-wraps and I really liked the different concept they had on their sushi rolls. It's simple and tasty, made for minimalist. 

The second time I dined in and ordered the ramen+wrap combo set of their Unami chicken ramen and the spicy tuna wrap. Their AC must not have been working well that day because it was very hot inside their restaurant and trying to eat hot soup didn't make it any better lol. I really liked the Unami chicken ramen, there was so much flavor and the chicken chashu was great. A lot better than the pork, less fatty. Sushi wraps were tasty as usual.
